vulnerability_findings.name: Callstack bug
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: (bool success, ) = msg.sender.call.value(amountToWithdraw)(""); // At this point, the caller's code is executed, and can call withdrawBalance again

vulnerability_findings.name: Reentrancy bug
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: (bool success, ) = msg.sender.call.value(amountToWithdraw)(""); // At this point, the caller's code is executed, and can call withdrawBalance again

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-eth
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in Reentrancy_insecure.withdrawBalance (reentrancy_insecure.sol#8-13):
	External calls:
	- (success) = msg.sender.call.value(amountToWithdraw)() (reentrancy_insecure.sol#10)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- userBalances (reentrancy_insecure.sol#12)

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in reentrancy_insecure.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.4.0 (reentrancy_insecure.sol#1): it allows old versions

vulnerability_findings.name: low-level-calls
vulnerability_findings.message:
Low level call in Reentrancy_insecure.withdrawBalance (reentrancy_insecure.sol#8-13):
	-(success) = msg.sender.call.value(amountToWithdraw)() reentrancy_insecure.sol#10

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
Callstack Depth Attack Vulnerability
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: (bool success, ) = msg.sender.call.value(amountToWithdraw)(""); // At this point, the caller's code is executed, and can call withdrawBalance again
